Detailed Description

Transaction functions.

Id:
transaction.c,v 1.11 2002/12/22 15:42:56 m Exp

Function Documentation

bool ta_commit ( void   ) 

Commits the data in the transaction buffer.

Data is written to the destination specified in ta_setdata(). The state is then set to clean.

This function must be called after each reset to commit pending transactions.

Return values:
TRUE on success.
FALSE on failure. Error code given in sw.

References hal_eeprom_read(), hal_eeprom_write(), SW_OTHER, sw_set(), TRANSAC_DATA_ADDR, TRANSAC_DATA_LEN, TRANSAC_STATE_ADDR, TRANSAC_STATE_CLEAN, and TRANSAC_STATE_DATA.

Referenced by auth_createVerifyCryptogram(), auth_setPin(), auth_verifyPin(), fs_create(), fs_delete(), and main().

bool ta_setdata ( iu8 *  data,
iu8  len,
iu16  dst 
)

Begins a transaction and sets the data.

data/len bytes are written to the transaction buffer. The destination address is also stored there. Then the state is set to TRANSAC_STATE_DATA.

Parameters:
data Pointer to the data to write into the transaction buffer.
len Length of the data. (Max.: TRANSAC_DATA_LEN)
dst Destination of the data in EEPROM.
Return values:
TRUE on success.
FALSE on failure. Error code given in sw.

References hal_eeprom_write(), SW_FILE_TO_SHORT, sw_set(), TRANSAC_DATA_ADDR, TRANSAC_DATA_LEN, and TRANSAC_STATE_ADDR.

Referenced by auth_createVerifyCryptogram(), auth_setPin(), auth_verifyPin(), fs_create(), and fs_delete().
